meanings.definition: A device or substance used to dilate or expand a body passage or opening.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used dilators to widen the patient's airway during the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The dilators helped to open up the blood vessels for better circulation.
meanings.sent3: The dilators in the hospital were always busy stretching things out.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted like dilators, spreading joy and happiness around the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright sunlight was like a natural set of dilators, expanding the room with light.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that dilates or expands something.
meanings.sent1: As a skilled architect, he was a master dilators of space, creating open and airy designs.
meanings.sent2: The young artist was a natural dilators of creativity, always coming up with new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The curious child was a little dilators, always stretching the truth to make stories more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a gentle dilators, making people's hearts grow with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The music was a powerful dilators of emotions, touching everyone in the audience deeply.
